TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Handler extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A Handler allows you to send and process and Runnable objects associated with a thread's .

remarks.para: A Handler allows you to send and process and Runnable objects associated with a thread's . Each Handler instance is associated with a single thread and that thread's message queue. When you create a new Handler, it is bound to the thread / message queue of the thread that is creating it -- from that point on, it will deliver messages and runnables to that message queue and execute them as they come out of the message queue.

There are two main uses for a Handler: (1) to schedule messages and runnables to be executed as some point in the future; and (2) to enqueue an action to be performed on a different thread than your own.

Scheduling messages is accomplished with the , , , , , , and methods. The post versions allow you to enqueue Runnable objects to be called by the message queue when they are received; the sendMessage versions allow you to enqueue a object containing a bundle of data that will be processed by the Handler's method (requiring that you implement a subclass of Handler).

When posting or sending to a Handler, you can either allow the item to be processed as soon as the message queue is ready to do so, or specify a delay before it gets processed or absolute time for it to be processed. The latter two allow you to implement timeouts, ticks, and other timing-based behavior.

When a process is created for your application, its main thread is dedicated to running a message queue that takes care of managing the top-level application objects (activities, broadcast receivers, etc) and any windows they create. You can create your own threads, and communicate back with the main application thread through a Handler. This is done by calling the same post or sendMessage methods as before, but from your new thread. The given Runnable or Message will then be scheduled in the Handler's message queue and processed when appropriate.

Docs.summary: Default constructor associates this handler with the for the current thread.

remarks.para:
Default constructor associates this handler with the for the current thread.
If this thread does not have a looper, this handler won't be able to receive messages so an exception is thrown.

public Android.OS.Message ObtainMessage ();
.method public hidebysig instance class Android.OS.Message ObtainMessage() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new from the global message pool.

remarks.para: Returns a new from the global message pool. More efficient than creating and allocating new instances. The retrieved message has its handler set to this instance (Message.target == this). If you don't want that facility, just call Message.obtain() instead.

.method public hidebysig instance bool Post(class Java.Lang.IRunnable r) cil managed

Docs.param: The Runnable that will be executed.
Docs.summary: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue.

remarks.para: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue. The runnable will be run on the thread to which this handler is attached.

.method public hidebysig instance bool Post(class System.Action action) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public bool PostAtFrontOfQueue (Java.Lang.IRunnable r);
.method public hidebysig instance bool PostAtFrontOfQueue(class Java.Lang.IRunnable r) cil managed

Docs.param: The Runnable that will be executed.
Docs.summary: Posts a message to an object that implements Runnable.

remarks.para: Posts a message to an object that implements Runnable. Causes the Runnable r to executed on the next iteration through the message queue. The runnable will be run on the thread to which this handler is attached. This method is only for use in very special circumstances -- it can easily starve the message queue, cause ordering problems, or have other unexpected side-effects.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool PostAtFrontOfQueue (Action action);
.method public hidebysig instance bool PostAtFrontOfQueue(class System.Action action) cil managed

The absolute time at which the callback should run, using the time-base.
Docs.summary: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue, to be run at a specific time given by uptimeMillis.

remarks.para: Causes the Runnable r to be added to the message queue, to be run at a specific time given by uptimeMillis. The time-base is . Time spent in deep sleep will add an additional delay to execution. The runnable will be run on the thread to which this handler is attached.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendMessage (Android.OS.Message msg);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendMessage(class Android.OS.Message msg) cil managed

Docs.summary: Pushes a message onto the end of the message queue after all pending messages before the current time.

remarks.para: Pushes a message onto the end of the message queue after all pending messages before the current time. It will be received in , in the thread attached to this handler.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SendMessageAtFrontOfQueue (Android.OS.Message msg);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SendMessageAtFrontOfQueue(class Android.OS.Message msg) cil managed

Docs.summary: Enqueue a message at the front of the message queue, to be processed on the next iteration of the message loop.

remarks.para: Enqueue a message at the front of the message queue, to be processed on the next iteration of the message loop. You will receive it in , in the thread attached to this handler. This method is only for use in very special circumstances -- it can easily starve the message queue, cause ordering problems, or have other unexpected side-effects.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SendMessageAtTime (Android.OS.Message msg, long uptimeMillis);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SendMessageAtTime(class Android.OS.Message msg, int64 uptimeMillis) cil managed

Docs.param: The absolute time at which the message should be delivered, using the time-base.
Docs.summary: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before the absolute time (in milliseconds) uptimeMillis.

remarks.para: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before the absolute time (in milliseconds) uptimeMillis. The time-base is . Time spent in deep sleep will add an additional delay to execution. You will receive it in , in the thread attached to this handler.

.method public hidebysig instance bool SendMessageDelayed(class Android.OS.Message msg, int64 delayMillis) cil managed

Docs.summary: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before (current time + delayMillis).

remarks.para: Enqueue a message into the message queue after all pending messages before (current time + delayMillis). You will receive it in , in the thread attached to this handler.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
